clinical_study.brief_title: Goal Directed Therapy Versus Standard Care in Lung Resection Surgery (GDT-thorax Study).
clinical_study.official_title: Goal Directed Therapy Versus Standard Care in Lung Resection Surgery, a Randomized, Controlled Trial (GDT-thorax Study).

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

clinical_study.source: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to quantify and compare the hemodynamic control of cardiac index in patients who receive either goal-directed therapy or standard hemodynamic management in lung resection surgery

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that the percentage of the intraoperative time in which the cardiac index is equal or superior to 2.2 l/min/m2 is higher in goal directed therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of the intraoperative time in which the cardiac index is equal or superior to 2.2 l/min/m2 (%)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the total duration of the surgery
primary_outcome.description: To compare the degree of hemodynamic control of cardiac index in both groups

secondary_outcome.description: To compare lactate, SvcO2 (central venous oxygen saturation) and PaO2/FiO2 ratio (ratio of arterial oxygen partial pressure to fractional inspired oxygen) in the first 24 hours in both groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 24 hours of finalization of lung surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To compare fluid balance (differences between the amount of water taken into the body and the amount excreted or lost) in the first 24 hours in both groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 72 hours of finalization of lung surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the incidence of AKI in both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Observation of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS)
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the incidence of ARDS in both groups
To compare hospital stay in both groups
To compare the mortality rate in both groups

arm_group.description: Target value is a cardiac index equal or superior to 2.2 l/min/m2.

intervention.description: Heart rate 60-100 beats per minute, mean arterial pressure 65 mm Hg, serum lactate 2 mmol/L, oxygen saturation 95 % (90 % during one lung ventilation).

The hemodynamic algorithm will be based on systolic volume index and fluid challenges. FloTrac sensor (this sensor connects to any existing arterial catheter and provides advanced hemodynamic parameters through pulse contour analysis) and EV1000 clinical platform (clinical platform from Edwards Lifesciences that provides advanced hemodynamic monitoring) will be used to calculate cardiac index and systolic volume index.
intervention.other_name: Goal directed fluid and hemodynamic management

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults patients ( 18 years old)
- Written informed consent
- Elective lung resection surgery (open or thoracoscopic lung lobectomy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe obesity
- Moderate to severe aortic insufficiency
- Renal failure requiring hemodialysis
- Left ventricle ejection fraction less than 35 %
- Urgent surgery

patient_data.ipd_description: Yes. Anonymized data for individual patient data is planned to be shared with all participants within 6 months of data completion
